articles.title: Apple introduces the advanced new Apple Watch Series 9
articles.summary: Apple introduced the Apple Watch Series 9, featuring the new S9 SiP chip, a brighter display, faster on-device Siri, and a magical new double tap gesture. This release marks Apple's first carbon-neutral products, aligning with its Apple 2030 goal to be carbon neutral across its entire business, manufacturing, and product life cycle by 2030. The new watch also runs watchOS 10 and introduces FineWoven bands as a leather alternative, along with new Nike and Hermès band collections.

articles.title: Apple unveils iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max
articles.summary: Apple has unveiled the iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max, featuring a strong and lightweight titanium design, a new customizable Action button, significant camera upgrades, and the A17 Pro chip for enhanced performance and gaming. The new models also support USB-C with faster speeds and introduce new safety features like Roadside Assistance via satellite. Pre-orders begin September 15, with availability starting September 22.

articles.title: Apple unveils its first carbon neutral products
articles.summary: Apple announced its first carbon neutral products, primarily the new Apple Watch lineup, marking significant progress towards its Apple 2030 goal of making every product carbon neutral. The company detailed innovations in design, clean energy use in manufacturing and product use, reduced transportation emissions, and the development of new materials like FineWoven which replaces leather. Apple also introduced a new tool called Grid Forecast to help users choose cleaner energy times for electricity consumption.

articles.title: Everything Apple Plans to Show on Sept. 12: iPhone 15, Watches, AirPods
articles.summary: Apple Inc. is set to unveil its latest products on September 12, including the iPhone 15 line, new smartwatches, and the latest AirPods. The event is expected to highlight the titanium iPhone 15 Pro, camera improvements, a switch to USB-C chargers, and faster smartwatches. This launch represents Apple's most significant new product unveiling of the year.

articles.title: I Can't Stop Thinking About How Awkward Apple's 'Mother Nature' Ad Was, and I Finally Figured Out Why
articles.summary: The author discusses Apple's "Mother Nature" ad featuring Octavia Spencer and Tim Cook, which aired during the iPhone keynote. While initially perceived as cringe-worthy and unfunny, the author concludes that the ad was effective in highlighting Apple's environmental efforts and contrasting them with competitors, even if it wasn't a comedic success. The ad addressed skepticism about Apple's carbon-neutral goals, particularly regarding the use of carbon credits, by having the "Mother Nature" character voice those criticisms.

articles.title: Apple: Streamlining Sustainability For Every Buyer's Perfect Product
articles.summary: Apple is prioritizing sustainability, aiming for all products to be carbon-neutral by 2030, a goal already achieved by the Apple Watch. The company's strategy involves significant emission reductions, increased use of renewable energy, and incorporating recycled materials, ensuring sustainability without compromising product features for consumers. Apple seeks to lead the tech industry towards a more responsible and environmentally conscious future.

articles.title: History of Apple in Photos, From Steve Jobs Era to $3 Trillion
articles.summary: This article chronicles the history of Apple, from its founding by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak to its recent achievement of a $3 trillion market cap under Tim Cook. It details key product launches like the Apple II, Macintosh, iPod, and iPhone, as well as leadership changes and challenges such as the recent DOJ lawsuit and declining iPhone sales in China. The article also touches upon Apple's expansion into services and new product categories like the Apple Watch and Vision Pro, alongside its pivot towards generative AI.

articles.title: Claim Construction – We Agree . . . Or Do We? – One-E-Way, Inc. v. Apple Inc.
articles.summary: This article discusses the Federal Circuit's decision in *One-E-Way v. Apple*, highlighting a dispute over a previously agreed-upon claim construction for "unique user code." The case illustrates that even agreed-upon claim constructions can lead to significant disagreements regarding their application to accused products, with Apple successfully arguing that the code must be associated with a user, not just a device. The ruling serves as a cautionary tale for litigants to ensure proposed claim constructions provide absolute clarity and are well-supported by intrinsic evidence.

articles.title: Apple unveils iPhone 15 Pro with titanium case, holds line on prices
articles.summary: Apple announced a new series of iPhones, including the iPhone 15 Pro with a titanium shell and improved features, while maintaining prices despite a global smartphone slump. The launch comes amidst economic uncertainty and increased competition in crucial markets like China. Apple also highlighted new watches and its commitment to becoming carbon neutral.

articles.title: Qualcomm will make Apple’s iPhone modems until 2026, and its stock surges
articles.summary: Qualcomm Inc. will continue to supply modem chips for Apple Inc.’s iPhones until at least 2026. This extended partnership suggests Apple's efforts to develop its own 5G modem chips are progressing slower than anticipated. Following the announcement, Qualcomm's stock (QCOM) experienced a significant surge of approximately 4%.

articles.title: Qualcomm to supply Apple Inc with 5G chips until 2026 under new deal
articles.summary: Qualcomm has signed a new deal with Apple to supply 5G chips for iPhones until at least 2026, extending their previous agreement which was set to expire this year. While the financial terms are similar to the prior deal, Qualcomm's financial projections assume that only 20% of iPhones will use its chips by 2026, as Apple continues to develop its own modem technology. A patent licensing deal between the companies, signed in 2019, remains in place and could be extended beyond its 2025 expiration.

articles.title: Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
articles.summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS), including its current stock price, key statistics like PE Ratio and Dividend Yield, and its top holdings as of August 31, 2025. The ETF has a portfolio value of $8.44 billion with top holdings including NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms. It also presents historical performance data and breakdowns of asset allocation and sector exposure.

articles.title: India's policy contradictions are making it harder for investors to crack its market
articles.summary: India's apparent policy contradictions, such as import restrictions on electronics despite efforts to attract foreign investment, are complicating the market for global investors. While Prime Minister Modi's "Make in India" initiative and production-linked incentives aim to boost domestic manufacturing and attract companies like Apple and Foxconn, protectionist measures and capital controls create uncertainty. These challenges exist even as India seeks to enhance its global reputation and capitalize on shifting geopolitical alliances and supply chain diversification away from China, potentially limiting its full economic growth and investment appeal.

articles.title: Equal Weight ETF EQL Hits Key Buy Signal
articles.summary: The article highlights the Alps Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL) as an intriguing tool to mitigate concentration risk in the S&P 500, particularly due to the dominance of a few tech firms. EQL, an equal-weight ETF, assigns equal weight to each sector and then to stocks within those sectors, offering diversification and strong performance. The fund hit a key buy signal as its price rose above its 50-day simple moving average.

articles.title: Qualcomm, Meta Platforms rise; J.M. Smucker, RTX fall, Monday, 9/11/2023
articles.summary: This article details the stock performance of several companies on Monday, September 11, 2023. Qualcomm and Meta Platforms saw their stock prices rise due to specific company news, while J.M. Smucker and RTX experienced declines following significant announcements. Other notable movers include Alibaba, FuelCell Energy, Carlisle Cos., and Freeport-McMoRan.

articles.title: The pros and cons of the Vanguard FTSE All-World ex-US ETF (VEU)
articles.summary: The Vanguard FTSE All-World ex-US ETF (VEU) offers extensive geographic and business diversification with over 3,700 holdings and a low annual management fee of 0.08%. While it provides exposure to many strong global companies outside the US, its exclusion of US businesses means it misses out on some top performers like Apple and Microsoft, which have driven higher returns in US-inclusive international ETFs. Despite this, VEU remains a strong choice for investors seeking broad non-US market exposure.

articles.title: All else being equal: Making the case for equal-weight ETFs
articles.summary: This article discusses the advantages and disadvantages of equal-weight ETFs compared to market-cap-weighted ETFs, particularly in the context of the S&P 500's concentration in a few large tech companies. It highlights how equal weighting can manage concentration and valuation risk, offer a value investment style tilt, and increase exposure to smaller, well-established companies. While equal-weight strategies may underperform when market gains are driven by a select few, they can offer diversification benefits and a "buy-low, sell-high" approach through rebalancing.

articles.title: Arm climbs 25% in Nasdaq debut after pricing IPO at $51 a share
articles.summary: Arm Holdings saw its stock jump nearly 25% on its first day of trading on the Nasdaq after pricing its IPO at $51 per share, valuing the company at almost $60 billion. SoftBank, which took Arm private in 2016, retains about 90% of the company's outstanding shares. Despite its high valuation relative to its current growth, Arm's unique royalty-based business model, including revenue from decades-old designs, and its strategic importance in AI and chip design, are key factors in investor interest.

articles.title: Arm, the Chip Designer, Raises $4.87 Billion in the Year’s Largest I.P.O. (Published 2023)
articles.summary: Arm, the British chip design company, successfully raised $4.87 billion in the largest initial public offering of the year, valuing the company at $54.5 billion. This I.P.O. is a significant event for SoftBank, which acquired Arm in 2016 and aims to capitalize on the tech industry's focus on artificial intelligence, following a failed acquisition bid by Nvidia. Arm's return to public markets under the ticker symbol ARM is being closely watched as a gauge of investor interest in new tech offerings.

articles.title: If You Like SPHQ, Check Out Quality ETFs XMHQ and XSHQ
articles.summary: The article highlights the growing popularity of quality ETFs, specifically discussing the Invesco S&P 500 Quality ETF (SPHQ) and suggesting that investors also consider mid-cap and small-cap quality ETFs like XMHQ and XSHQ for broader exposure. It emphasizes that quality factors are significant across all market capitalizations and details how these Invesco funds select their holdings based on quality scores. The piece also provides insights into the AUM and recent inflows for each ETF, noting the key differences and similarities in how they track quality within their respective market segments.
